akn:content.akn:p: “Bonds” means the bonds, notes, or other obligations issued by the District pursuant to the Energy Efficiency Financing Act.
“Chief Financial Officer” means the Chief Financial Officer of the District of Columbia.
“Debt Service” means the principal and interest on the Energy Efficiency Loan.
“Energy Efficiency Financing Act” means the Energy Efficiency Financing Act of 2010 [Chapter 17R of Title 8].
“Energy Efficiency Loan” means an energy efficiency loan to a property owner under the Energy Efficiency Financing Act [§ 8-1778.01 et seq.].
“Energy Efficiency Loan Agreement” means a loan, or other agreement, entered into pursuant to [§ 8-1778.43(a)], to make the Energy Efficiency Loan.
“Indenture of Trust” means the indenture relating to the bonds, as modified, amended, or supplemented from time to time.

“Lot” means real property as defined in § 47-802(1) where such real property for billing and collection purposes under this subchapter shall be further described with the letters “PC” preceding the sequence of square, suffix and lot, or parcel and lot, numbers under § 47-802(1).
“Tax year” has the same meaning as provided in § 47-802(7).

“Special Assessment” means the special assessment levied by the District each fiscal year to fund the amount necessary to pay the debt service on the Energy Efficiency Loan and applicable fees and costs.
“Special Energy Assessment Fund” means the nonlapsing fund established by section 201 of the Energy Efficiency Financing Act [§ 8-1778.21].
